bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Andrew Johnson was the seventeenth President of the United States (1865-1869), following Lincoln's assassination. Johnson presided over the Reconstruction. Johnson was criticized as being too sympathetic to southern white males in his plan for reconstruction. Johnson was the first President of the United States to be impeached; however he was not removed from office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The check is made out for $276.63 to Cooper's Acct's and signed by Andrew Johnson, June 17, 1868. The check number is 178 and the bank is the First National Bank. There is also a 2 cent stamp in the upper right corner.
